topic.title: Watch NOW before this is taken down - #ShadowGate
topic.body:
Millie Weaver was abducted by the Deep State ("arrested" as they would like to have people believe) for producing this documentary. It will not likely be on YouTube for very long that being said as it exposes the corruption within the Shadow Government and the Intelligence Community in the USA.

https://youtu.be/DDL3jGrrbco

1597367837_1BaoKFcxVPG6NEagoQhg78Cw3U2nj.body:
> [marcusfinch](#comment_16_1JKZJh2XYF8C6q5p7T7FmiL3JDux2CxWyJ): I think what will help is projects will be dead or very slow until shit hits the fan then the sheep will be crying out for something.  Since we realize this, we should prepare by making/finding/using things that are ready to roll out at a moments notice to the general public.

This is EXACTLY what must be done for the sake of public safety and human rights. If we do not think ahead, then the consequences for the masses will be dire and long lasting. Prevention is always cheaper than correction in politics and business I have come to find.

> [dude](#comment_23_1APx2pf1wNGFz4mWCN2sFzrtTGzrLKZUQ2): There was project like this https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GoTenna but problem is you always need their special hardware.When you want to fix internet for masses you need something working with what people already have - smartphones, - so it must be software, using regular wifi for radio comms.

I had one blueprinted for cell phones and laptops that travel too, and this is how I found https://Freifunk.net/en/ which gladly offered any assistance necessary for my project in America. Well, one of the small groups did, but it seemed to speak for the whole. Anyway, its definitely doable.

> [driud](#comment_90_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC1PQkH): Witam; Ciekawy projekt; Pytanie?. Czy sÄ… inne tego typu projekty?. Jak moÅ¼na siÄ™ do tego przyÅ‚Ä…czyÄ‡?. Czy jest coÅ›, na temat po Polsku?. Jak bardzo trudno to zainstalowaÄ‡?. Czy ktoÅ› posiada wiedzÄ™ w tym temacie.JeÅ›li tak; to proszÄ™ o wiÄ™cej informacji na ten temat..Wireless Mesh Networks to Circumvent Internet BlackoutsHello; Interesting project; Question?. Are there other projects of this type?. How can you join this?. Is there anything in Polish?. How hard is it to install?. Does anyone have knowledge in this topic.If so; then I am asking for more information on this.

There are other projects of this type; a quick startpage for wireless mesh networks uncensorable (or similar search terms) should show many results.

The means to sign up vary I am sure based on the projects design. More can be found on the individual project's respective websites.

I am sure Polish language projects are beginning to exist. This is a new concept for civilian use. Previously mainly used in military.

Relatively easy to install with a little tech knowledge.

Others may be able to help you more I am sure. :)

Let us know if you come across any interesting findings or set up some cool networks! :D

> [xcape2net](#comment_773_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): The problem with mesh networks is that you can't have a mesh network until you have users.  And, you can't have users until you have a mesh network.  It's a catch 22.

I have clients all over the US and in Europe.... And in Scandinavia....

So... i have users... Lol

I am just too tired to create an English version of Freifunk as I set out to do originally last year seeing as Covid made me have to work more for less money to survive... So annoying...

However, with the help of the collective we will get this sorted out in no time I am sure... ;-)

#WWG1WGA
#FollowTheWhiteRabbit

> [xcape2net](#comment_774_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): By "clients", do you mean people who are actually running mesh networks with more than one or two nodes.  How big are they, and why haven't I heard of them?

Customers; I run an InfoSec company.

> [xcape2net](#comment_774_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): By "clients", do you mean people who are actually running mesh networks with more than one or two nodes.  How big are they, and why haven't I heard of them?

I suppose maybe I misinterpreted what you meant to convey in your post. My apologies. I figured you meant that one must have a network of people which could be easily convinced of the benefits of taking part in a mesh network.

> [otbtechnologies3](#comment_39_12QcU9x7iK1XjguRKQKKhyc6ErguzYMkRc): I suppose maybe I misinterpreted what you meant to convey in your post. My apologies. I figured you meant that one must have a network of people which could be easily convinced of the benefits of taking part in a mesh network.

That being said, I feel you are overcomplicating the process involved in getting such a project off the ground successfully.

Once people realize the importance of Mesh Networks in protecting their Constitutional Rights if the traditional internet becomes censored as is happening at an ever accellerating rate in the USA, then there will be plenty of willing participants.

Its quite simple really... 

Just my 2 cents .

Its going to start out small; only niche groups will adopt it (think Bitcoin.) Then, the rest will eventually wake up (again, think Bitcoin.) For your reference: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/4/45/DiffusionOfInnovation.png

Anyway, there are already many projects similar enough to the one I have in my mind such as "Bridgefy" for messaging which has over a million users, and also we have "Anyfi" to provide internet access via mesh networking as well with over 100,000 users... It is going to happen regardless of difficulty of establishing the network because demand is going to begin to soar soon if my predictions are correct (which they usually are for the most part with regard for such things as this...) Any additional comments, questions, or concerns though?..

> [xcape2net](#comment_775_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): People will not spend around $100 on a device that they cannot use to connect to a mesh network because there are few or no other devices within range.  For example, I would love to connect to the goTenna network, but I will not pay $189 for two units when no others are within range of my home.  And, I do understand the value of mesh networks in protecting my constitutional rights.  I also understand what is happening to the Internet that is changing it an a way that takes my free speech away.  The only way a useful mesh network can be deployed is if thousands of people all sign up at the same time to be part of it.  That only happens when they have no other alternative ISP's.

Sigh. Suit yourself as I proceed to prove my point lol :)

> [xcape2net](#comment_775_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): People will not spend around $100 on a device that they cannot use to connect to a mesh network because there are few or no other devices within range.  For example, I would love to connect to the goTenna network, but I will not pay $189 for two units when no others are within range of my home.  And, I do understand the value of mesh networks in protecting my constitutional rights.  I also understand what is happening to the Internet that is changing it an a way that takes my free speech away.  The only way a useful mesh network can be deployed is if thousands of people all sign up at the same time to be part of it.  That only happens when they have no other alternative ISP's.

Your argument is remarkably similar (as I mentioned multiple time already) to the arguments with which I was presented by the masses in 2010-2011 when Bitcoin was still between 10-30 dollars a piece. Sure enough 5-7 years later and more and more people were approaching me until the peak of at least a dozen people a day asking how to use the cryptocurrency as it reached its peak price of almost 20,000USD a per unit lol

"That'll never catch on."
"Its worthless if no other users"
"I can still use fiat, so why bother?"

I remember it All like yesterday...

Now I can pay my taxes and bills in the cryptocurrency :)

You will see...
Oh... And fancy the fact that ZeroNet is built on the technology itself... Must be worthless technology though... Hehe :)

Oh... And, let's not forget the fact that many other country's governments have instituted their own "official" cryptocurrencies and tokens based off on Blockchain even though I was told Bitcoin will "never catch on" back in 2010/2011 for the exact same reasons you are telling me mesh networks will not catch on now. Haha :)

"When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" --John Maynard Keynes.

"The measure of intelligence is the ability to change." --Albert Einstein.

"Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything." --George Bernard Shaw.

1597408822_1G7AgufdSvApA47h2Y4JhFMViX1g5.body:
> [1bfqutudhtexlka](#comment_197_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2EhuAY): just use tox with tor proxy enabled

Wouldn't be end-to-end encrypted that way, but would help with anonymity. Sure.

Ricochet ensures nothing leaves the Tor Network but using Tor proxy leaves one susceptible to interception of data by the exit node.

> [isprivy](#comment_2_166cC3iVpxLQrFXrkoHRbJ7r6RB4ckJshz): you should try demonsaw, DPI resistant and you control your salt,ciphers, iterations. https://www.demonsaw.com/# feel free to join our router @ privy.ws port 1337

I have several complaints:

1.) Not open source...
2.) Not Post-Quantum Secure...
3.) Not compatible with any of the Beds which is what everyone is switching to now since a high level executive at Facebook took on a leadership role within The Linux Foundation this past week or so... Also, many others yet are switching to BSDs because some APTs even low level Black Hats can somewhat easily compromise many Linux Systems on the Market today... These individuals are ever increasing their level of sophistication in said attacks too due to the rapid increase in Linux users earlier this year...

Just my 2 cents...

Solutions?

1.) Make Open Source and offer generous bug bounties... Would require some well planned management strategies in order to do this, but it shouldn't be too difficult...
2.) Introduce XMSS Cipher...
3.) Introduce compatible version for the Beds or at least FreeBSD since demand will soar soon...

> [isprivy](#comment_3_166cC3iVpxLQrFXrkoHRbJ7r6RB4ckJshz): well  it was previously open and the encryption code is opensource (demoncrypt ) ,  there is an upcoming  version under another name is getting worked on which will satisfy your requests. Unfortunately mcaffee did NDA my friend eijah.3.) Not compatible with any of the Beds which is what everyone is switching to now since a high level executive at Facebook took on a leadership role within The Linux Foundation this past week or so... Also, many others yet are switching to BSDs because some APTs even low level Black Hats can somewhat easily compromise many Linux Systems on the Market today... These individuals are ever increasing their level of sophistication in said attacks too due to the rapid increase in Linux users earlier this year...  [...]

Hm, ok. I will keep my eyes peeled for the next release and may well just have to adopt this technology once it has arrives. Thank you! :)

Idk. I used to do a lot of stuff out in the open regarding exposing corruption until about 9 years ago when I got hit by a Ford F250 and later received a text message full of Satanic Symbols when I got out of the hospital that also said, "We're Watching You..." I got hit the day after explaining to my best friend over the telephone that I had information on how the CIA may still be operating covertly through (just as this video says) private intelligence agencies to conduct similar operations as MKUltra.

I later gave that information to the authorities once I put two and two together. I was told to lay low because they felt my life may be in danger if I did not. They told me not to tell ANYONE that I had provided such information to them and that they would figure out what was going on as soon as they could. Not too long after my conversations with the detectives, the ring leader of the operation I had exposed suddenly disappeared, and I also helped take down another unrelated local operation as well...

But hey, YMMV when exposing things I guess! :P

He has more information but he cant make that public unless he is called in to give testimony. The ShadowGate Doco only contains information that's available in the public domain, which keeps him legal, while trying to gain exposure of the information he has to a wider audience. I would also expect him to have a dead mans switch, and given his level of access I'm sure he has plenty of meaty bones to throw out there. Bumping him off may not be the best option for the vermin that may wish him harm. [...]
